channel.title: JasonCable.com's GLBT PodCast, A Gay and Lesbian Talk Show.
channel.description: Gay and Lesbian talk radio brought to you 3-4 times per week covering the important issues of the GLBT community. Plug in and listen to the Internet's informative gay talk radio.
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2005-2011, Jason L. Cable. All Rights Reserved
channel.itunes:subtitle: Gay and Lesbian Talk Radio
channel.itunes:summary: Gay and Lesbian talk radio brought to you 3-4 times per week covering the important issues of the GLBT community. Plug in and listen to the Internet's informative gay talk radio: Jason Cable.com's GLBT Podcast.
channel.itunes:author: Jason Cable

item.title: #159 Confused
item.itunes:subtitle: I am confused. What rights should we fight for? Who should do it? At what government level? Etcetera... PLUS a little on Dr. Phil on how he wants to be Suze Orman.

item.title: #157 The Agenda of the Country
item.itunes:subtitle: An update on where I think we should be headed with the LGBT rights battle in this country... today. Also, an update on my status.

item.title: #156 Cheaper than a Shrink
item.itunes:subtitle: This one rambles a bit as life has been a little rough this past few months. Sometimes you need to just get things off of your chest. Also, my various work coming out experiences.

item.title: #150 3rd Anniversary Retrospect
item.itunes:subtitle: For this first time in a while I am actually proud of something. My voice was going and I just had to get my 150th episode of the podcast for my third anniversary (23 June 2005). I decided to do a nice restrospect, showing different ideas and time periods of my own development. It's hard to believe how far I've travelled in three years.
item.description: For this first time in a while I am actually proud of something. My voice was going and I just had to get my 150th episode of the podcast for my third anniversary (23 June 2005). I decided to do a nice restrospect, showing different ideas and time periods of my own development. It's hard to believe how far I've travelled in three years.
item.itunes:summary: For this first time in a while I am actually proud of something. My voice was going and I just had to get my 150th episode of the podcast for my third anniversary (23 June 2005). I decided to do a nice restrospect, showing different ideas and time periods of my own development. It's hard to believe how far I've travelled in three years.
item.itunes:author: Jason Cable

item.title: #148 Focus on OUR Family
item.itunes:subtitle: A high-level overview of Focus on the Family along with a view into their world and take on the LGBT community. Basically, we are sinners and are actually straight.

item.title: #147 God Hates Fags
item.itunes:subtitle: Real, Raw, Jason. This is about as bad as it gets out there folks. I cover the homophobic, disgusting Fred Phelps and his Westboro Baptist Church of Topeka, Kansas. Also, some of your feedback.
item.description: Real, Raw, Jason. This is about as bad as it gets out there folks. I cover the homophobic, disgusting Fred Phelps and his Westboro Baptist Church of Topeka, Kansas. Also, some of your feedback.

item.title: #146 Celebrity
item.itunes:subtitle: In this podcast I talk about a variety of issues surrounding celebrities, especially whether they should be out and proud or not.
item.description: In this podcast I talk about a variety of issues surrounding celebrities, especially whether they should be out and proud or not.
item.itunes:summary: In this podcast I talk about a variety of issues surrounding celebrities, especially whether they should be out and proud or not.
item.itunes:author: Jason Cable

item.title: #145 Kinsey Knew
item.itunes:subtitle: Alfred Kinsey was thinking about the issues we face today back in 1948. He solved our greatest problems. He saw 60 years ago what we see today. Yes, things may have been in a different perspective then but the ideas apply to our situations today.
item.description: Alfred Kinsey was thinking about the issues we face today back in 1948. He solved our greatest problems. He saw 60 years ago what we see today. Yes, things may have been in a different perspective then but the ideas apply to our situations today.
item.itunes:summary: Alfred Kinsey was thinking about the issues we face today back in 1948. He solved our greatest problems. He saw 60 years ago what we see today. Yes, things may have been in a different perspective then but the ideas apply to our situations today.
item.itunes:author: Jason Cable

item.title: #144 Homophobia Defined
item.itunes:subtitle: The definition of homophobia is something we rarely think about yet should. It has changed with society and is still at the forefront of our struggles as gay people.
item.description: The definition of homophobia is something we rarely think about yet should. It has changed with society and is still at the forefront of our struggles as gay people.
item.itunes:summary: The definition of homophobia is something we rarely think about yet should. It has changed with society and is still at the forefront of our struggles as gay people.

item.title: #142 Focus on OUR Family
item.itunes:subtitle: In this podcast I take on a very recent radio ad by James Dobson's Focus on the Family about a bill in Colorado that gives rights to GLB & T individuals in public accommodations. I also explore a new term for me, genderqueer. Listen to find out more...
item.description: In this podcast I take on a very recent radio ad by James Dobson's Focus on the Family about a bill in Colorado that gives rights to GLB & T individuals in public accommodations. I also explore a new term for me, genderqueer. Listen to find out more...

item.title: #136 Civics Lesson
item.itunes:subtitle: A lesson on American government. We all need to know how this country works and most of us have no clue. I try to educate you to the best of my ability. Comments and corrections: post on http://jasoncable.com or leave a message at (888) 272-5848.

item.title: #122 When Science Fails
item.itunes:subtitle: My study of psychology is teaching me about how much those outside of the GLBT community do not adequately understand us or our issues. Listen to hear about how a multicultural psychologist describes LGBT issues.

item.title: #120 Validating the Kinsey Scale
item.itunes:subtitle: I found modern research that validates the Kinsey Scale and Kinsey's landmark 1948 sexuality study. Sexual orientation is NOT a matter of black, white, and grey.
